intro: Gunillaea emirnensis, commonly known as the Emirnensis gunilla, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Its foliage is narrow and grass-like, with small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
